name: places/ChIJDye6YrhYwokRPYvp0g1-f3k
formattedAddress: 1476 York Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1476 York Ave, New York, NY 10075-8816, USA

originalText.text: Only have white towels and washcloths laundered at this location. The items come back in a word, nasty. When asked to have them rewashed I’m told, “You just don’t want to pay.” Actually, I have paid and well in fact, for a very poor job while being insulted.

text.text: Only have white towels and washcloths laundered at this location. The items come back in a word, nasty. When asked to have them rewashed I’m told, “You just don’t want to pay.” Actually, I have paid and well in fact, for a very poor job while being insulted.

originalText.text:
I have used this cleaners for years with at least 7 pieces a week.  They were great to pick up and deliver.  However recently they lost a 900 suit and a 200 shirt and took absolutely no responsibility.  They kept deflecting the issue and putting it back on me when I had proof based on Life360 that I dropped it off.

Sadly since I trusted them so much in the past I had them pick up and drop off without a receipt and therefore I had no proof.

They are taking no responsibility and not even trying to find my most dry cleaning.

Please learn from my expensive lesson for a dry cleaner that will not work with you or help you when they loose their customers merchandise.

Please contact me further and I can explain.  I have reported them to the BBB and 311.

Please beware.

originalText.text:
If I had the ability to give no stars I would. I took a bridesmaid dress to this place to be altered. The dress was brand new, tags still on, straight from the manufacturer. I tried on the dress in their store and they made the alterations. When I picked up my dress, the snagged part of it, and there were GREASE STAINS AND FOOD ON THE DRESS. It looked like someone was eating lunch while they did the alterations. The worst part - when I told them they needed to fix it and give me a refund, they refused and proceeded to blame me for the snag and the stains. I picked them because of the good reviews on here, but was obviously very mislead. I will never, ever again use them for any service whatsoever. They could have saved me as a customer if they would have at least taken responsibility and given me a refund or a credit or something, but they refused.

Very poor customer service and inexcusable work on the dress. Steer clear.

originalText.text:
Please don't use Postisman Cleaners. Ray, the guy that is working in the store, is rude and has an attitude. He steals your money if you pay cash and gives you an alternative service. So, I took four shirts to dry clean. The cleaners hand-washed my shirts and Ironed them. Ray, the representative, is referring to this as dry cleaning. If you don't want your closed to be ruined and especially if you are new to this area, don't take your clothes here.

I am listing the steps below for Dry cleaning, what you get from the Potisman Cleaners is washed in Machine and hand pressed for $7.45 per shirt.

This information is a great help in assisting the drycleaner to care for your garments.

The Drycleaning Process!

Step 1: Identification and Inspection
When you leave garments for cleaning they are inspected and identified with a tag which stays with the garment until it is returned to you.

Step 2: Spotting and stain removal
Your trained drycleaner skillfully removes spots and stains in conjunction with a number of specialized solutions.

Step 3: Sorting
Garments are sorted for cleaning by category and colour with consideration being given to the manufacturers recommended care label instructions.

Step 4: Drycleaning
Garments are then drycleaned using a special internationally standard clear solution which removes dirt and grease safely from the most delicate and sensitive fabrics.

Step 5: Drying
Garments are dried using temperatures appropriate to the type of garment and in conjunction with any recommendation from the manufacturer's care label instructions.

Step 6: Pressing and Finishing
Garments are pressed to give those crisp clear pleats and creases that signify a drycleaned garment. Garments are steam formed to restore body and shape and remove wrinkles.

Step 7: Final inspection and packaging
Garments are given a final inspection and prepared for collection.

originalText.text: No issues since we started using Potisman. Always greeted with a happy face. Fixed trousers, cuffs and buttons, frequently on the spot when needed. Great service.
